spec.name: Pinto Building
spec.description: The Pinto Building is a historical residential and commercial structure, completed in 1932. It was designed by the **Suraqui Brothers (Elias and Joseph)**, prominent Jewish Moroccan architects who significantly shaped Casablanca's Art Deco skyline. The building's architecture is a strong example of the Art Deco style, featuring elegant symmetry and detailing. Its historical and architectural quality was formally recognized by its designation as a **National Material Patrimony** site in 2018.

timeline.title: National Material Patrimony Declaration
timeline.description: The building was officially included in the National Material Patrimony of Morocco.

access.comment: Building is inhabited; exterior view is public, interior access is restricted to residents/tenants.
